Package scenegraph

Class AbstSpatial

  • java.lang.Object
    • scenegraph.AbstSceneObject
      • scenegraph.AbstNode
        • scenegraph.AbstSpatial
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, ChannelInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstCamera, AbstGeometry, AbstLight, Group, SkyBox
    public abstract class AbstSpatial
extends AbstNode
    Base class for all spatial components in the scene graph. These can be components that will be visible in the scene or components that influence the rendering and view of the scene (lights, cameras). They all have in common that they have a position/orientation in the 3D scene, which is determined by a translation vector, rotation matrix (or vector) and scale vector (which together forms the local transformation matrix). Examples for these objects are geometric objects, which are drawn on screen as well as light sources and cameras.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ursula Derichs

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstSpatial

        public AbstSpatial​(java.lang.String name)
        Constructor sets translation vector to (0, 0, 0), scale to (1, 1, 1) and rotation matrix to identity matrix (this means no translation, no scaling and no rotation of original object). Local and global transformation matrices are set to the Identity. It also creates channels to all spatial attributes.
        Parameters:
        name - object's name

      • AbstSpatial

        public AbstSpatial​(AbstSpatial obj)
        Copy Constructor.
        Parameters:
        obj - object to be copied

      • AbstSpatial

        Default Constructor assigns a default name for the object

      • setRotation

        public void setRotation​(Vec3 r)
        Sets rotation vector and construct rotation matrix for the rotation angles around x-, y, z- Axis. Vector contains Euler angles. The Euler angles are extrinsic (fixed axes: x, y, z-axis, fixed order: XYZ.)
        Parameters:
        r - rotation vector

      • setRotation

        public void setRotation​(float r1,
                        float r2,
                        float r3)
        Sets rotation vector and construct rotation matrix for the rotation angles around x-, y, z- Axis. Vector contains Euler angles. The Euler angles are extrinsic (fixed axes: x, y, z-axis, fixed order: XYZ.)
        Parameters:
        r1 - rotation angle for x Axis
        r2 - rotation angle for y Axis
        r3 - rotation angle for z Axis

      • setGlobalTransform

      • draw

        public boolean draw​(AbstRenderer renderer)
        Passes this object to the renderer (if it is not hidden). In detail: 1) Requests the renderer to calculate the new transformation matrix. The transformation matrix is the multiplication result of the transformation matrix of the surrounding group within the scenegraph (this matrix lays on top of the stack) and the local transformation matrix. 2) Requests the renderer to draw the object. 3) Finally requests the renderer to throw away again the transformation matrix.
        Overrides:
        draw in class AbstNode
        Parameters:
        renderer - the renderer for the scene
        Returns:
        true
